questions.text: What is the defining characteristic of a simple pendulum?

answers.text: A heavy bob attached to a flexible, weightless string
A bob attached to a rigid rod
A pendulum with a long string
A pendulum with a large amplitude

questions.text: The period of a simple pendulum depends primarily on which of the following?
What is the formula for calculating the time period of a simple pendulum for small oscillations?

answers.text: The period equals 2 times pi times the square root of the length divided by gravity
The period equals length divided by gravity times 2 times pi
The period is independent of length and gravity
The period equals gravity times length divided by 2 pi

questions.text: What happens to the period of a pendulum if the length of the string is quadrupled?
When a pendulum swings with a small amplitude, which energy transformations occur during its motion?

answers.text: Kinetic energy to potential energy and back
